result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Douglas Lee

records.addlTxt:
3:45 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video with William Douglas Lee who appeared in person.  INCLUDES: 22CF447 (PH) 21CT191, 21CT265, and 22CM370 (all STC). Court notes Atty Selmer's request to appear by zoom for hearing. Atty Selmer and DE would like to proceed. 22CF447: S/T Investigator Michael O'Keefe, SCSO; direct by Atty Ballo. Cross by Atty Selmer. Attys argue bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court finds good cause to extend time for ARGN. Court questions DE who would like to have ARGN when Atty Selmer can be in person. Court will change ARGN if DE needs to change date. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. DE / Atty may request zoom if desired. Adjourned: 4:20 pm.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Request to appear by zoom for today at 3:45pm.  Filed by Atty Selmer. sm      Per TCH on 11-1-22.  Zoom is approved.  Clerk to advise Atty. sm

Attorney Scott Selmer appeared by video for William Douglas Lee. Defendant William Douglas Lee appeared by video. Includes 21CT191 STC, 21CT265 STC, 22CF447 PH, and 22CM370 STC. Court reviews case. Atty Selmer notes today was an issue for DE to appear in person. Court sets PH in 22CF447 and STC in all other files with Court Commissioner. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 11:39 AM
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:23 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer in court for William Douglas Lee. Defendant William Douglas Lee in court. Includes 21CT191, 22CT265, 22CF447, 22CM370. Court reviews case. Court sets PH in 22CF447 and all other matters for STC.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Selmer. arc

Includes 22CF447 and 22CM370.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

Defendant to have baseline test today (8/18/22) at Justice Support Center. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph N.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:48 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo with Intern Connor Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant William Douglas Lee in court. Includes 22CF447 and 22CM370. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD- Atty Selmer appointed on different matter. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets STC with other matter previously scheduled with Branch 2. Court enters NG plea and reserves on pre-plea rights in 22CM370. Adjourned at 1:56 PM. gll
